Section 1.title: Classical Physics: An Overview
Section 1.description: This section provides a foundational understanding of classical physics, covering its key concepts and principles, including Newton's laws and electromagnetism.

Section 2.title: Limitations of Classical Theories
Section 2.description: Here, we explore the shortcomings of classical physics, focusing on phenomena that classical theories cannot adequately explain, such as blackbody radiation and the photoelectric effect.

Section 3.title: The Birth of Quantum Mechanics
Section 3.description: This section introduces the key historical developments that led to the formulation of quantum mechanics, highlighting important physicists and their contributions.

Section 4.title: Key Experiments in Quantum Physics
Section 4.description: An exploration of crucial experiments, such as the double-slit experiment and the Stern-Gerlach experiment, that illustrate the principles of quantum mechanics and challenge classical intuitions.

Section 5.title: Fundamental Concepts of Quantum Mechanics
Section 5.description: In this section, we delve into core ideas of quantum mechanics, such as wave-particle duality, uncertainty principle, and quantization, making them accessible for beginners.

Section 6.title: Applications of Quantum Mechanics
Section 6.description: We discuss real-world applications of quantum mechanics in technology and science, including semiconductors, lasers, and quantum computing, to illustrate its significance.
